Suyun derinliklerinden çıkıp, iki oyun boyunca kapkaranlık ortamlara alıştıktan sonra klostrofobisi  olmayanı bile hasta eder. B.Infinite'in gökyüzüne kurulmuş muhteşem şehri ile karşılaşıyoruz. Ortamın güzelliğinden gözünü alamıyorsunuz tabi. Mağaradan çıkıp doğayı görmek gibi bir şey bu:D. 
  Oynanış olarak 1 ve 2. oyun kadar zor değil, oyun hikaye devamlılığına bağlı olarak devam ettiriyor oyuncuyu. Yer yer sıkıldığım bölümleri oldu özellikle final kısmında . "Ne bu? Cidden böyle mi bitti? Sonuç ne sonuç?" gibi daha birçok sorularla ortada bırakıyor.
  Tüm serinin ana hikayesini  bu oyunun ek paketlerini  oynadıktan sonra anlayabiliyoruz, sadece bu oyunu alıp oynarsanız olaylar havada kalıyor. Asıl finali neden ek pakete bırakma ihtiyacı duydunuz ki? Birinci oyundan başlayıp tüm seriyi ek paketleri dahil alıp oynamanızı tavsiye ederim. Oynarken çıldırsam da Bioshock serisini çok sevdim. İnsanın içine dokunan vurucu anlatımları var. :)
pretty fun gameplay and a lot of very cool locations as you progress through the story
True masterpiece.

Bioshock Infinite is an inventive, fresh take on the series, offering massively improved graphics, excellently designed stages and well polished gunplay mechanics. The unique, story-centric shooter presents a campaign that is not only challenging and full of entertaining collectibles, but also confounding and awe-inspiring in its narrative. I haven't much bad to say about the game, except for the impression that it might leave you on the line in terms of comprehension of the plot, maybe even intentionally so, to make the writers themselves seem more mysterious. 
Besides this, the combat is highly enjoyable and merits repetition, I am fond of the Clash In the Clouds expansion particularly because it it gives you plenty of time to explore the combat mechanics yet is not afraid to challenge you and kill you outright. Ken Levine and Shawn Robertson undoubtedly surpass any realistic expectation levied against them in lou of Bioshock with this piece, its brings the game play for fans familiar to the series to much bigger and better heights with implementations such as the sky-line, the rechargeable shield and Elizabeth's "tears" and items that allow you to keep fighting when you would have normally died. The Burial At Sea expansions are also a an engaging story in addition to the excellent writing in Infinite and gives the players a return to Rapture, something that long time fans like myself I'm sure have been hoping for. 
I look forward to whatever Ghost Story Games has in store for us in the future, thank them for this masterclass in addictive game creation and encourage anyone who is a fan of Halo, Bioshock or similar shooters to give this a spin.

Best in the series when nostalgia isn't factored in. I just powered through all 3 games and this had by far the best gameplay. The story was almost as good as the first one but the characters felt more defined in this third game. 10/10 would recommend.

Che dire di BioShock Infinite, gioco ormai datato vista la sua uscita nel lontano 2013 ma che riesce a coinvolgere ancora con la sua trama. Proprio quest'ultima si presta ad essere il punto focale del gioco, ben disegnata e con tante piccole chicche narrative. Il gameplay generale lascia un pò a desiderare, il sistema di combattimento è quello tipico di uno sparatutto, poche armi e poca possibilità di personalizzarle, accanto a queste ci saranno però i vari Vigor che daranno un pò di enfasi ai combattimenti. La grafica cartoonesca è gradevole nonostante si tratti di un gioco ormai datato. Consiglierei questo gioco solo per la trama come detto prima.

As one who'd never played either of the first two Bioshock games, this was a little strange at first, but after making my way through the campaign, I have nothing but good things to say about the experience. Although the narrative was initially a little confusing, the action was [i]fun[/i]; the world, characters, and visual style were all very original and imaginative; the UI was streamlined; and the game as a whole was generally bug-free, well-written, and quite thoughtful.  I recommend this one whether it's on sale or not.

Ignore my hours...I played a bit offline and I beat this game back like 6-7 years ago on xbox360...I don't need a ton of time to tell you how awesome it is for a singleplayer experience. It will throw a lot of feelings at you, and probably blow your mind a bit by the end. I've forgotten smaller details over the year, so I'm happen to be playing it again and ready to experience the epic, deep story again. It will probably have you questioning everything about morals and society.

I was 16 when I played infinite for the first time, I didn't understand one bit of it back then. I remember binging through youtube videos to understand what this game means. 

Move forward 6 years, I'm 22 now and decided to play it again and it stood firm through the test of time. The gameplay is very responsive and maybe not very tough on the normal difficulty but Elizabeth is the heart and soul of the gameplay. You truly end up caring about both Booker and Elizabeth. The game is mindgasmic and leaves u questioning by the end of it. But it's worth playing every bit of it!

Coming to the DLC's, there were three DLC's. One is endless horde mode and other challenge modes to climb on the leaderboards where the main focus is map design and gameplay!

The other two DLC's are story-based gameplay that loops around the first Bioshock game as events take place before the game! The story choices are debatable, some may like it and some may not! I didn't like it, due to many loopholes. I like the new stealthy gameplay choices in 2nd episode playing as Elizabeth without powers, while the 1st episode plays similar to the base game but with limited ammo, so that's a plus too.

Overall, I'll like to conclude that this game is a must-play for its strong mindgasmic story and enjoyable gameplay!

Simply the best game I have ever played (at the time of this review).

The narrative of Bioshock Infinite is incredible. A complex story that holds you from beginning to end, nothing about it is predictable and it baffles you. The game has no cutscenes, everything is played in the air during the gameplay and it is necessary that the player is really inside the game, paying attention to every detail because if you are distracted for a moment it is almost certain to lose the thread. A lot is explained through voxophones that are scattered on the map, in lines from the npcs of Columbia, in things that can certainly go unnoticed, so be on the whole game to not miss anything because the story is beautiful and fantastic. And it is almost certain that you will finish it more than once to understand the story well or for pure pleasure.

The gameplay is very good. It matches very well with the game and the map, it is easy to play and very enjoyable.

Infinite's scenery is stunning. The game is set in Columbia, a floating city and unlike anything you've ever seen. At each place you see something different, something that conveys a message to you, NPCs with excellent AI talking about something, it's really fantastic.

The soundtrack is beautiful. It fits perfectly with the moments of the game and in several moments you are faced with songs from the time when Infinite (1912) takes place. In addition to having original compositions of the time, there are "re-recordings" of newer songs to make them look "older".

This game is a great example that a complete masterpiece can exist, incredible characters, remarkable story, extremely fun gameplay and a very interesting and well developed world, we explored this universe by controlling Booker DeWitt in the company of the incredible Elizabeth (BEST COMPANION OF THE GAMES), we explored great Columbia, one of the best backgrounds for a game, a seemingly perfect city more than revealed by the height of human rot, where inequality is explicit, racism is practiced without any punishment and religious fanaticism is intrinsic to the population , where a profiteer and villain of the story Zachary Comstock, takes advantage of blind faith to call himself a prophet. With one of the best plots if not the best in the history of video games, Bioshock infinite rewards you with a great experience worthy of the Bioshock series, with the right to a great plot twist in history, which will make you think and play again for a total understanding, hardly you will forget this universe.

"A COMPLETE AND DELICIOUS MASTERPIECE TO EXPERIENCE" 10/10 - My favorite game of life!

[h1]Infinitely Fantastic [/h1] 

Diehard Bioshock fans complain about this game, and many people claim that the story makes no sense, but it really doesn’t deserve the hate it gets. The story, as confusing as it is, does make logical sense and does have one of the best video game twists ever, and that’s saying something when Bioshock has done that twice now. Something no one can argue about is how damn good it feels to shoot sky racists. The balance of weapons and abilities is perfect, and the tear ability can really make scenarios more interesting. I know it won’t be for everyone, but personally this game is fantastic, and it makes my top 5 of all time.

Story: 10/10 (probably a 6-7 if you don’t get it)
Environment: 10/10
Gameplay: 10/10
Overall: 10/10
worse than the last two its like they took all the worst things in the first two and threw them in a garbage can and took the shittest and used it to make infinite  0/10

Tl;dr

I loved the original Bioshock(s). I really did not have any fun with Bioshock Infinite…

Why that?

I loved the graphics of Bioshock, the setting, the omnipresence of water, risk of floods, varied special powers and weapons. Interaction with the world and varied enemies. You had to think, you had to use finesse to go though the levels. You had choices in the way of doing things, you had choice amongst alternate routes.

There is none of that in Bioshock Infinite: The setting in flying cities is much less believable and give way fewer interesting levels: If you don’t look out of the window, you could think you are in a normal town! I did not like the art style either (but this is personal). Weapons are all the same, simply different names, models, and rate of fire. I would rather have 4 vastly different and very well-designed weapons than 10 boring ones.

In Bioshock Infinite you can just blast thought the levels, killing everyone via brute force, or simple using the same special power over and over. There are no alternate routes, no real secrets. And there is a check-point system which is a pain in the ass for a PC game (what if you had to leave and need to turn off your computer? Seriously?)

You know the irony? I liked the DLC “Burial at Sea”! How that? Because it makes you goes back to Bioshock 1 world in a nicely setup adventure. That confirmed the feeling I had about Infinite: This is not a good game after all...

Just skip it and play Bioshock 1 & 2 instead. You will have much more fun and good time with them!

게임이 게임 자체가 가진 존재의 이유인 재미를 꾸준하게 추구하는 것과는 별개로 하나의 예술로서 인정 받기 위한 노력으로 스토리에 많은 공을 들인 게임들이 종종 보이는데, 이 게임은 그러한 점에서 많은 점수를 주고 싶다.
물론 게임의 재미 또한 못해도 평작 이상의 평가는 충분하다.
뒤늦게 1편과 2편을 건너 뛰고 이걸 해볼까 하시는 분들 게시면 나름 고역이겠지만 해보고 나서 3편 인피니티를 하길 권해 드린다.

good story

Fantasia perfeita! O jogo te envolve dentro de um mundo imaginário perfeitamente construído, um lugar que desejaríamos morar o resto de nossas vidas. A jogabilidade é bem polida, os gráficos são muito atraentes e o enredo é bem trabalhado e surpreendente! Todas os defeitos de missões que deixaram o Bioshock 1 e 2 irritantes em determinado ponto foram eliminados nesse jogo, não deixe de jogar!
不愧是第九艺术，画面美得像在看画展，射击游戏完全不是重点，好的故事使我一直专注着剧情。不过我不会玩第二遍的，因为剧情代入感强烈，结尾过于伤感
